message.content: This question requires knowledge about animals that shed their skin or fur. Option (B), monkey, is the correct answer. Monkeys, like many other mammals, undergo a process called moulting, where they shed their old fur and grow new fur. Option (A), frog, is incorrect because frogs do not shed their skin, but instead, they undergo a process called molting, where they shed the outer layer of their skin. Option (C), chicken, is incorrect because chickens do not shed their feathers, but they may lose or replace individual feathers throughout their lifetime. Option (D), salmon, is incorrect because salmon do not shed their scales.

This question requires basic knowledge about the ability of animals to shed their skin or fur. Option (B) is correct because monkeys are mammals that can shed their fur. Frogs (option A) shed their skin, but they are not mammals. Chickens (option C) and salmon (option D) do not shed their skin or fur.

This question requires knowledge about the process of shedding in animals. Option (B) is the correct answer because monkeys, like other mammals, regularly shed their hair or fur. While some other animals listed in the options may go through molting or shedding of scales or feathers (such as frogs, chickens, and salmon), monkeys are the only option that consistently sheds hair or fur.

This question requires basic knowledge about different types of animals and their characteristics. Animals that can shed their skin or fur include reptiles and mammals. Frogs (option A) are amphibians and do not shed their skin like reptiles do. Chickens (option C) and salmon (option D) are both types of animals that do not shed their skin or fur. Monkeys (option B) are mammals and some species of monkeys, like the spider monkey, shed their fur. Therefore, option B is the correct answer.

This question requires knowledge about the process of shedding in animals. Animals that can shed their skin or fur include reptiles, such as frogs, as well as mammals, such as monkeys. Option (B) is correct because monkeys are animals that can shed their fur. Option (A) is incorrect because while frogs do shed their skin, they are not known for shedding fur. Option (C) is incorrect because while chickens do molt and lose feathers, they do not shed fur or skin. Option (D) is incorrect because salmon do not shed their skin or fur.

This question requires knowledge about animals that have the ability to shed their skin. Option (B) is correct because monkeys, like many other animals such as snakes and lizards, have the ability to shed their skin. Option (A) is incorrect because frogs do not shed their skin like reptiles do. Option (C) is incorrect because chickens do not shed their skin. Option (D) is incorrect because salmon do not shed their skin; however, they do undergo physical changes during their lifecycle, including changes in coloration.

This question requires knowledge about animals and their ability to shed. Shedding refers to the process of an animal losing its outer layer of skin or fur. Option (B) is correct because monkeys are known to shed their fur. Option (A) is incorrect because frogs do not shed their skin, they molt it. Option (C) is incorrect because chickens do not shed, they molt their feathers. Option (D) is incorrect because salmon do not shed their scales.

This question tests knowledge of animals that undergo molting or shedding of their outer layer. Option (B), a monkey, is incorrect because monkeys do not shed their fur. Option (A), a frog, is incorrect because frogs do not undergo molting or shedding. Option (C), a chicken, is correct because chickens molt and shed their feathers. Option (D), a salmon, is incorrect because salmon do not shed their scales.

This question requires understanding of the different animals and their ability to shed their skin or fur. A type of animal that can shed its skin or fur is a monkey. Option (A) is incorrect because frogs do not shed their skin; they molt. Option (C) is incorrect because chickens do not shed their feathers; they molt as well. Option (D) is incorrect because although salmon lose scales during their spawning journey, it is not considered shedding in the same sense as animals that shed their skin or fur.

This question tests our understanding of the characteristic of shedding in animals. Shedding refers to the process of an animal naturally losing its old or damaged skin, fur, feathers, or scales and replacing them with new ones. Frogs (option A) do not shed in the same way that mammals do. They may shed their skin, but it comes off in pieces rather than in a complete shedding. Chickens (option C) and salmon (option D) do not shed at all. Monkeys (option B), on the other hand, are mammals and typically shed their fur as part of their natural growth cycle. Therefore, the correct answer is option B.

This question requires basic knowledge about animals and their ability to shed their skin, fur, or feathers. Option (B) is correct because monkeys, specifically certain species of primates, shed their fur. Option (A) is incorrect because frogs do not shed their skin; instead, they molt and shed their outer layer of skin. Option (C) is incorrect because chickens do not shed their feathers; instead, they undergo a molting process where old feathers fall out and new ones grow. Option (D) is incorrect because salmon do not shed their scales; instead, they grow new scales as they grow and mature.

This question requires knowledge about the ability of animals to shed their skin. Option (B) is correct because monkeys are mammals that shed their fur. Frogs (option A) can shed their skin but not in the same way as mammals. They undergo a process called molting where they shed their outer layer of skin. Chickens (option C) do not shed their feathers, they molt and replace them periodically. Salmon (option D) do not shed their skin.

This question requires knowledge about animals that undergo the process of shedding. Shedding is the process in which an animal sheds or replaces its outer skin or fur to allow for new growth. While all of the options are animals, only some of them can shed. Frogs and chickens do not shed their skin or fur, so options (A) and (C) can be eliminated. Salmon do not have external skin or fur that they shed, so option (D) can also be eliminated. The correct answer is option (B), monkey, as some species of monkeys shed their fur.

This question requires knowledge about the ability of animals to shed their skin or fur. Among the given options, monkeys are the only type of animal that can shed. Frogs do not shed their skin but instead undergo a process called molting where they shed their outer layers. Chickens do not shed their feathers, but they molt and regrow new feathers in a process called feather molt. Salmon do not shed their scales, but they do undergo various changes in appearance as they transition between freshwater and saltwater habitats. Therefore, option (B) is the correct answer. Options (A), (C), and (D) are incorrect because they do not accurately describe animals that can shed.

Salmon (option D) are fish and do not shed their scales like mammals do. Therefore, the correct answer is option B, monkey.

Monkeys are one type of animal that can shed, while frogs, chickens, and salmon do not shed in the same way. Option (A) is incorrect because while frogs do shed their skin, it is not the same as shedding fur or hair. Option (C) is incorrect because chickens molt, but they shed feathers rather than fur or hair. Option (D) is incorrect because while salmon do shed their skin, they do not have fur or hair to shed.
